name: Beer Battered Vegan Fried Fish
description: This is the best Beer Battered Vegan Fried Fish! Made from hearts of palm, Old Bay seasoning, and a rich beer batter, the tender fried “fish” is best served with tartar sauce and fries. Just like authentic fish and chips, but better!
recipeIngredient: (2) 15-ounce cans hearts of palm, drained and rinsed
Air Fryer Fries (or other french fries!)

itemListElement.text: To a food processor, add the drained hearts of palm, bread crumbs, vegan mayo, crumbled nori, old bay seasoning and salt.
itemListElement.name: To a food processor, add the drained hearts of palm, bread crumbs, vegan mayo, crumbled nori, old bay seasoning and salt.

itemListElement.text: Pulse several times to combine, but make sure there is still some texture and even large chunks. Don't process into a paste. If the mixture seems really wet, add another 1/4 cup breadcrumbs and pulse.
itemListElement.name: Pulse several times to combine, but make sure there is still some texture and even large chunks. Don't process into a paste. If the mixture seems really wet, add another 1/4 cup breadcrumbs and pulse.

itemListElement.text: Using your hands, form into fish like shapes, about 2-3 inches long and 1 inch wide.  Use about 2 tablespoons per fish stick.
itemListElement.name: Using your hands, form into fish like shapes, about 2-3 inches long and 1 inch wide.  Use about 2 tablespoons per fish stick.

itemListElement.text: Place the sticks on a plate lined with parchment paper and let them chill in the refrigerator while you prepare the batter.
itemListElement.name: Place the sticks on a plate lined with parchment paper and let them chill in the refrigerator while you prepare the batter.

itemListElement.text: To make the beer batter, whisk together the flour, garlic powder, paprika, old bay seasoning, salt and pepper.
itemListElement.name: To make the beer batter, whisk together the flour, garlic powder, paprika, old bay seasoning, salt and pepper.

itemListElement.text: Gradually whisk in the beer until a batter forms and is smooth.
itemListElement.name: Gradually whisk in the beer until a batter forms and is smooth.

itemListElement.text: Add oil to a large, heavy bottomed pot about 2-3 inches deep. Heat to 375 degrees F, using a thermometer for best results and safety.
itemListElement.name: Add oil to a large, heavy bottomed pot about 2-3 inches deep. Heat to 375 degrees F, using a thermometer for best results and safety.

itemListElement.text: Quickly dip the chilled fish sticks into the batter one at a time, then place in the hot oil, carefully.  I use a fork to dip them in and carefully out of the batter. Handle them gently or they will fall apart, but once they are fried they are very sturdy.
itemListElement.name: Quickly dip the chilled fish sticks into the batter one at a time, then place in the hot oil, carefully.  I use a fork to dip them in and carefully out of the batter. Handle them gently or they will fall apart, but once they are fried they are very sturdy.

itemListElement.text: Cook for about 3 minutes on each side, until golden brown.
itemListElement.name: Cook for about 3 minutes on each side, until golden brown.

itemListElement.text: Drain on a wire rack. Enjoy immediately with Vegan Tartar Sauce and Air Fryer Fries, or use in Vegan Fish Tacos.
itemListElement.name: Drain on a wire rack. Enjoy immediately with Vegan Tartar Sauce and Air Fryer Fries, or use in Vegan Fish Tacos.

keywords: vegan fish recipe, vegan fried fish
